title: Scientific Paper Graph Quality
alt: The worst are graphs with qualitative, vaguely-labeled axes and very little actual data.
transcript:
General quality of charts and
graphs in scientific papers[A graph is shown with the y-axis on the origin labeled "bad", on the arrowhead labeled "good", and the x-axis being a timeline labeled with decades from 1950s to 2010s.][The pre-1993 and post-2015 parts are white, with increasing quality before 1990 and after 2015. The 1993-2015 part indicates bad quality and is highlighted in grey, labeled "PowerPoint/MSPaint era".]
